definition: Romance of the West Chamber by Wang Shifu 王實甫|王实甫[Wang2 Shi2 fu3]
west
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
box (in theater)/side room/side
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: His two famous works are "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" and "The Story of the Western Chamber".
sentences.chinese: 他最有名的作品是“梁山伯与祝英台”和“西厢记”。

sentences.english: Romance of the Western Bower has been adapted for stage by many genres of traditional Chinese operas.
sentences.chinese: 《西厢记》被许多传统的中国剧种搬上舞台演出。

sentences.english: Experts are collating and annotating difficult sentences in The Romance of West Chamber.
sentences.chinese: 专家们在校注《西厢记》中比较难懂的字句。

sentences.english: Chapter Four talked over the style criticism of The West Chamber in Ming and its remained questions.
sentences.chinese: 第四章评价明清《西厢记》风格论及存在的问题。

sentences.english: Reading Romance of the Western Bower, one must burn incense.

definition: Wang Shifu (fl. 1295-1307), author of Romance of the West Chamber 西廂記|西厢记
A Dream of Red Mansions (first completed edition 1791) by Cao Xueqin 曹雪芹[Cao2 Xue3 qin2], one of the four great novels
The Injustice to Dou E (popular drama by 關漢卿|关汉卿[Guan1 Han4 qing1])
The Peony Pavilion (1598), play by Tang Xianzu 湯顯祖|汤显祖[Tang1 Xian3 zu3]
Jinpingmei or the Golden Lotus (1617), Ming dynasty vernacular novel, formerly notorious and banned for its sexual content
Strange Stories from a Chinese Studio, Qing dynasty book of tales by 蒲松齡|蒲松龄[Pu2 Song1 ling2]
Yuan dynasty theater, including poetry, music and comedy
a Yuan dynasty form of musical comedy
The Peach Blossom Fan, historical play about the last days of the Ming dynasty by Kong Shangren 孔尚任[Kong3 Shang4 ren4]
Tale of the White Snake/Madame White Snake
The Scholars, Qing dynasty novel by Wu Jingzi 吳敬梓|吴敬梓[Wu2 Jing4 zi3], an extended satire on the Imperial Examination system
Song and Yuan literary form based on vernacular folk stories
Stories Old and New by Feng Menglong 馮夢龍|冯梦龙[Feng2 Meng4 long2], collection of late Ming baihua 白話|白话[bai2 hua4] tales published in 1620
Guan Hanqing (c. 1235-c. 1300), Yuan dynasty dramatist in the 雜劇|杂剧 tradition of musical comedy, one of the Four Great Yuan dramatists 元曲四大家
actor's lines (in theater)
The Butterfly Lovers, Chinese folktale of the tragic love between Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai
pinyin: Liang2 Shan1 bo2 yu3 Zhu4 Ying1 tai2
